answerText: Maxwell relations [do not accept or prompt on "Maxwell's equations"][10] The Maxwell relation derived from this thermodynamic quantity uses the partials of entropy and volume, this quantity's natural variables. By the First Law of Thermodynamics, the change in this quantity equals heat plus work.
heading: ACF Regionals 2014 |2014 | Harvard-Florida A-Louisville A | 10 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] Name these statements which relate the partial derivatives of pressure, volume, temperature, and entropy.
